posts.content:
Some hints for understanding how the For Sale part of the forum works...

If you are selling loads of items - please put them all in a single post

If you create a new post for each item - no one else gets a look-in

If you are interested in buying something, please make it obvious to sellers. "First dibs", or "Can I buy that from you please" are good examples.

This may sound obvious, but ambiguity sometimes creeps into posts.

The For Sale section normally works on a first-dibs basis, but occasionally people ask for offers, or "how much is this worth?".

First dibs and Offers work like this:

* First dibs applies when items are posted for sale with a price.

* If the seller asks for offers, wants to know how much something is worth - then 'first dibs' does not apply. They are asking for an opinion / offer on selling price.

The seller is then free to choose which offer they want to accept.

thanks

Miles.
